intro: Begonia cavallyensis, commonly known as the Cavally begonia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of West Africa. It belongs to the Begoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking, ornate leaves that often feature intricate patterns and vibrant colors. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red, adding to its ornamental value. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
